conclusion: Understand the flow of liquid through the baffles to determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into.
Baffles are designed to redirect the flow of liquid; arrows indicate the path the liquid takes.
Liquid flows from A, B, C, and D and is directed by the baffles.
Liquid from A is directed by the green baffle and flows into container E.
Liquid from B is directed by the yellow baffle and flows into container F.
Liquid from C is directed by the blue baffle and flows into container F.
Liquid from D is directed by the white baffle and flows into container E.
Liquid from A flows into container E.
Liquid from B flows into container F.
Liquid from C flows into container F.
Liquid from D flows into container E.
Liquid from A and D will flow into container E.
Liquid from B and C will flow into container F.
